DataElement.preferredName: Patient Interval Therapeutic Procedure Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no indicator related to the evaluation of the period of time between when a person receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care  and elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial and the administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Interval Therapeutic Procedure Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the period of time between when personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial are assessed and the administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Interval Therapeutic Procedure Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: The period of time or the distance separating two instances, events, or occurrences.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: The period of time or the distance separating two instances, events, or occurrences.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Changed from CTEP to COG for by script Thu Jan 2 10:00:57 EST 2014

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Did more than 7 days elapse b
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did more than 7 days elapse between eligibility studies and treatment start date
